articles.author: Patrick Durkin
articles.title: AFL, NRL, F1 GP set for restart - The Australian Financial Review
articles.description: The AFL has confirmed its season will return on June 11 without crowds and the NRL will restart its season on May 28.
articles.content:
Rugby Australia has said it is aiming to resume training in June and restart games in July. The domestic netball competition is also looking at July and soccer's A-League is aiming to resume its season from August 1.
Daniel Riccardo is switching from Renault… [+2725 chars]

articles.author: F1
articles.title: McLaren swoop for Daniel Ricciardo as Carlos Sainz replacement for 2021 - Formula 1
articles.description: The former Red Bull driver will swap Renault for the McLaren at the end of this year once his current contract expires, with Carlos Sainz making way
articles.content:
In the second big driver move of the week, McLaren have announced the signing of Daniel Ricciardo for 2021 on a "multi-year" deal.
Ferrari revealed on Tuesday that Sebastian Vettel would be leaving the team at the end of the year a move which has triggered a… [+2235 chars]

articles.author: none
articles.title: Footy's back - AFL
articles.description: The AFL on Friday announced the Toyota AFL Premiership season will resume on June 11
articles.content:
The AFL has today announced that clubs will return to training on Monday, May 18 and the 2020 Toyota AFL Premiership season will resume on Thursday, June 11. 
Players and football department officials will return to clubs on Monday, with clubs completing a 3… [+10581 chars]

articles.title: AFL set to announce season resumption, return to training - ESPN Australia
articles.description: AFL CEO Gillon McLachlan has confirmed footy will resume on June 11, with a vast number of new initiatives and protocols in place to ensure the sport's return.
articles.content:
AFL CEO Gillon McLachlan has confirmed the 2020 season will resume on June 11, following a telephone hookup with club presidents and CEOs on Friday.
Editor's Picks

articles.description: Lionel Messi insisted Barcelona cannot win the UEFA Champions League unless they improve their performances, disagreeing with head coach Quique Setien.
articles.content:
